p: Toxicity: Ethanolic extract of aerials parts and root of C. ternatea have been studied at 200â€“3000 mg/kg, p.o in mice. A cathartic effect of root extract was observed. Mice treated with a dose above 2000 mg/kg had ptosis and were lethargic. The extract was not lethal orally but resulted in severe CNS depression and death when used intraperitoneally at dose of 2900 mg/kg and above [ 140]. Taur and Patil [ 146] reported LD 50 of ethanolic extract of C. ternatea root to be more than 1300 mg/kg.
